content:
SessionSwitchEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the SessionSwitch event.

In this Article

public delegate void SessionSwitchEventHandler(object sender, SessionSwitchEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
Delegate
SessionSwitchEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a SessionSwitchEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see NIB: Events and Delegates.
